intro: Huerniopsis gibbosa, commonly known as the woolly cushion plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Andes Mountains of South America, particularly in Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in clustered umbels. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and alpine settings.
